required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Interfaces Program to Promote Work Ability of People With Disabilities
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Effectiveness of "The Interfaces Program" to Promote Person's Components, Performance and Improving the Work Environment of People With Disabilities

brief_summary.textblock: the objectives of the study is to Evaluate the effectiveness of "The Interfaces Program" to promote person's components, performance and improving the work environment of people with disabilities.

detailed_description.textblock:
People with disabilities experience many barriers in trying to integrate into the competitive market. The barriers may be result of the unique characteristics of the individual (characteristics of the disability, occupational history, work self-efficacy, etc.), the characteristics of the occupation and occupational performance (characteristics of the job and the job demands) and environmental barriers (accessibility, discrimination, stigma and lack of opportunities, etc.). The main response to the integration problems of people with disabilities in the world of work is supported employment service. Supported employment focuses primarily on placement of the individual and do not relate to barriers relating to the individual's ability to develop a career.
The present study examines the effectiveness of a new intervention program "The interfaces program " aiming to promote career development process among people with disabilities working in the competitive market. The program presents an integration of the Person-Environment-Occupation-Performance (PEOP) model and lead career development theories. The ultimate goal of this study is to examine the effectiveness of the "interfaces program" by examining its impact on the promotion of objective and subjective measures among people with disabilities who work and receive supported employment services.

primary_outcome.measure: proactive behavior Questionnaire (developed for this study)
primary_outcome.time_frame: A change in proactive behavior measure will appear after 9 sessions over 3 month (4 first meeting will be done once a week, and 5 meetings once in two weeks) of intervention, and after 3 month form the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: proactive behavior during the last week

primary_outcome.time_frame: A change in subjective experience of participation measure will appear after 9 sessions over 3 month (4 first meeting will be done once a week, and 5 meetings once in two weeks) of intervention, and after 3 month form the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: subjective experience of participation in meaningful occupations

primary_outcome.time_frame: A change in work behavior measure will appear after 9 sessions over 3 month (4 first meeting will be done once a week, and 5 meetings once in two weeks) of intervention, and after 3 month form the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: employer assessment of work behavior and work performance

primary_outcome.time_frame: A change in work self efficacy measure will appear after 9 sessions over 3 month (4 first meeting will be done once a week, and 5 meetings once in two weeks) of intervention, and after 3 month form the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: subjective report of work self efficacy

primary_outcome.measure: health perception sf 12 Questionnaire Health Perception
primary_outcome.time_frame: A change in health perception measure will appear after 9 sessions over 3 month (4 first meeting will be done once a week, and 5 meetings once in two weeks) of intervention, and after 3 month form the end of the intervention

primary_outcome.measure: career self management - subjective self management perception Questionnaire - developed for this study
primary_outcome.time_frame: A change in career self management measure will appear after 9 sessions over 3 month (4 first meeting will be done once a week, and 5 meetings once in two weeks) of intervention, and after 3 month form the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: subjective report of career self management

primary_outcome.measure: perception of environmental work barriers - subjective work barriers perception Questionnaire - developed for this study
primary_outcome.time_frame: A change in perception of environmental barriers will appear after 9 sessions over 3 month (4 first meeting will be done once a week, and 5 meetings once in two weeks) of intervention, and after 3 month form the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: subjective perception of environmental work barriers

arm_group.description: supported employment using the individual placement and support (IPS) model

intervention.description: supported employment using the individual placement and support (IPS) model

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- psychiatric or physical disability
- 12 years of educations minimum
- at least 26 score on the Montreal cognitive assessment ( MOCA)
- working at least 3 month in the open market
Exclusion Criteria:
- autistic spectrum disorder (ASD)
- Developmental Cognitive Disability
- alcohol or drags comorbidities
